text: Approval for the medstone sts(tm) lithotripter in conjunction with actgall(r).  When used with the drug, this device is indicated for the treatment of symptomatic, solitary, radiolucent, non-calcified gallstones (between 4 and 20 mm in maximum diameter) in adult patients for whom surgical removal of the gallbladder is medically contraindicated and in symptomatic high-risk patients who have actively refused surgery.  Combination therapy consists of 1) administration of actigall(r) (8-10 mg/kg/day) for at least two weeks pre-lithotripsy, 2) lithotripsy treatments of up to 2000 24 kv shocks, and 3) continued administration of actigall(r) until a stone-free state is achieved.
